questions.question: What is the output of this circuit?
questions.svg: <svg width="280" height="140" viewBox="0 0 280 140"><text x="5" y="35" font-size="11" fill="#374151">A=1</text><text x="5" y="75" font-size="11" fill="#374151">B=0</text><text x="5" y="115" font-size="11" fill="#374151">C=1</text><line x1="30" y1="30" x2="60" y2="30" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="70" x2="60" y2="70" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 60 15 L 60 85 Q 100 85 100 50 Q 100 15 60 15" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="50" x2="140" y2="50" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="110" x2="140" y2="110" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="140" y1="110" x2="140" y2="70" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 140 35 Q 150 35 150 60 Q 150 85 140 85 L 140 35" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 150 35 Q 190 50 190 60 Q 190 70 150 85" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="190" y1="60" x2="250" y2="60" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="255" y="65" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">?</text><text x="75" y="55" font-size="10" fill="#374151">AND</text><text x="155" y="65" font-size="10" fill="#374151">OR</text></svg>
questions.hint: First compute A AND B, then take that result and OR it with C. Work step by step.

questions.question: Convert $-5$ to 8-bit two's complement.
questions.hint: First write $+5$ in 8-bit binary, then flip all bits, then add $1$ to the result.

questions.question: What is the output of this circuit?
questions.svg: <svg width="260" height="120" viewBox="0 0 260 120"><text x="5" y="40" font-size="11" fill="#374151">A=1</text><text x="5" y="80" font-size="11" fill="#374151">B=1</text><line x1="30" y1="35" x2="60" y2="35" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="75" x2="60" y2="75" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 60 20 L 60 90 Q 100 90 100 55 Q 100 20 60 20" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="108" cy="55" r="8" fill="white" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="116" y1="55" x2="150" y2="55" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="150,35 150,75 190,55" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="198" cy="55" r="8" fill="white" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="206" y1="55" x2="230" y2="55" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="235" y="60" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">?</text><text x="68" y="60" font-size="9" fill="#374151">NAND</text><text x="158" y="60" font-size="9" fill="#374151">NOT</text></svg>
questions.hint: First compute A NAND B, then apply NOT to that result. Work through both gates.

questions.question: What is $10110_2 + 1101_2$ in binary?
questions.hint: Convert both to decimal ($22$ and $13$), add them, then convert back to binary.

questions.question: What is the hexadecimal of binary $11111111_2$?
questions.hint: Split into groups of 4 bits: $1111$ and $1111$. Each $1111 = 15$ in decimal = which hex digit?

questions.question: In a half adder, what is the CARRY output when $A=1$ and $B=1$?
questions.hint: In a half adder, CARRY $= A \land B$. What is $1 \land 1$?

questions.question: What is the decimal value of the 8-bit two's complement $11111110_2$?
questions.hint: MSB is $1$, so it's negative. To find the value: flip all bits, add $1$, then negate.

questions.question: What is $11010_2 - 1011_2$ in binary?
questions.hint: Convert to decimal ($26 - 11$), subtract, then convert back to binary.

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{\overline{A} \land \overline{B}}$
questions.hint: Apply De Morgan's law: $\overline{\overline{A} \land \overline{B}}$ becomes the opposite operation with non-inverted inputs.

questions.question: What is the hexadecimal of decimal $255$?
questions.hint: $255 = 15 \times 16 + 15$. What's $15$ in hexadecimal? Put that in both positions.

questions.question: What is the SUM output of a half adder when $A=1$, $B=1$?
questions.hint: In a half adder, SUM $= A \oplus B$. What is $1 \oplus 1$?

questions.question: Convert hexadecimal $\text{2A}_{16}$ to decimal.
questions.hint: $\text{2A}_{16} = 2 \times 16 + \text{A}$. Remember $\text{A} = 10$ in decimal.

questions.question: What is the output of this circuit?
questions.svg: <svg width="280" height="140" viewBox="0 0 280 140"><text x="5" y="35" font-size="11" fill="#374151">A=1</text><text x="5" y="105" font-size="11" fill="#374151">B=0</text><line x1="30" y1="30" x2="50" y2="30" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="50,15 50,45 80,30" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="88" cy="30" r="6" fill="white" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="94" y1="30" x2="130" y2="30" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="100" x2="50" y2="100" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="50,85 50,115 80,100" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="88" cy="100" r="6" fill="white" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="94" y1="100" x2="130" y2="100" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="130" y1="30" x2="130" y2="50" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="130" y1="80" x2="130" y2="100" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 130 50 L 130 80 Q 170 80 170 65 Q 170 50 130 50" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="170" y1="65" x2="230" y2="65" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="235" y="70" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">?</text><text x="55" y="32" font-size="8" fill="#374151">NOT</text><text x="55" y="102" font-size="8" fill="#374151">NOT</text><text x="140" y="68" font-size="8" fill="#374151">AND</text></svg>
questions.hint: First apply NOT to both A and B, then AND the results together.

questions.question: What is $11111111_2 + 1$ in 8-bit binary (with overflow)?
questions.hint: The result would be 9 bits, but we only keep 8. What remains after discarding the carry?

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{A \lor B}$
questions.hint: De Morgan's law: when you NOT an OR, the operation changes to AND and inputs get inverted.

questions.question: Convert binary $10101100_2$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: Split into nibbles: $1010$ and $1100$. Convert each 4-bit group to one hex digit.

questions.question: What Boolean expression represents a 2-input XOR gate?
questions.hint: XOR outputs $1$ when inputs differ: when $A=1$ and $B=0$, OR when $A=0$ and $B=1$.

questions.question: What is hexadecimal $\text{B5}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: Convert each hex digit to 4 bits: $\text{B} = 1011$, $5 = 0101$. Combine them.

questions.question: In a full adder with $A=1$, $B=1$, $C_{in}=1$, what is the SUM?
questions.hint: $1 + 1 + 1 = 3$ in decimal $= 11_2$ in binary. The SUM is the rightmost bit.

questions.question: Convert decimal $200$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: $200 \div 16 = 12$ remainder $8$. Convert $12$ to hex (a letter), and keep the $8$.

questions.question: What is the output of this circuit?
questions.svg: <svg width="280" height="120" viewBox="0 0 280 120"><text x="5" y="40" font-size="11" fill="#374151">A=0</text><text x="5" y="80" font-size="11" fill="#374151">B=1</text><line x1="30" y1="35" x2="60" y2="35" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="75" x2="60" y2="75" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 60 20 Q 70 20 70 55 Q 70 90 60 90 L 60 20" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 70 20 Q 110 40 110 55 Q 110 70 70 90" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="78" y1="45" x2="78" y2="65" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="118" cy="55" r="6" fill="white" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="124" y1="55" x2="230" y2="55" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="235" y="60" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">?</text><text x="75" y="58" font-size="9" fill="#374151">XNOR</text></svg>
questions.hint: XNOR is the opposite of XOR. First find A XOR B, then invert the result.

questions.question: What is $-1$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: Start with $+1$ ($00000001_2$), flip all bits, then add $1$. What pattern do you get?

questions.question: How many different values can $16$ bits represent?
questions.hint: The formula is $2^n$ where $n$ is the number of bits. Calculate $2^{16}$.

questions.question: In a full adder with $A=1$, $B=1$, $C_{in}=1$, what is the CARRY out?
questions.hint: $1 + 1 + 1 = 3$ in decimal $= 11_2$ in binary. The CARRY is the leftmost bit.

questions.question: Simplify: $A \land (A \lor B)$
questions.hint: Absorption law: if $A$ is true, the whole expression is $A$. If $A$ is false, $A \land$ anything is false.

questions.question: Convert hexadecimal $\text{FF}_{16}$ to decimal.
questions.hint: $\text{FF}_{16} = \text{F} \times 16 + \text{F} = 15 \times 16 + 15$. Calculate the sum.

questions.question: What is the output of this 3-input AND gate?
questions.svg: <svg width="220" height="140" viewBox="0 0 220 140"><text x="5" y="30" font-size="11" fill="#374151">A=1</text><text x="5" y="70" font-size="11" fill="#374151">B=1</text><text x="5" y="110" font-size="11" fill="#374151">C=0</text><line x1="30" y1="25" x2="60" y2="25" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="65" x2="60" y2="65" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="105" x2="60" y2="105" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 60 10 L 60 120 Q 120 120 120 65 Q 120 10 60 10" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="120" y1="65" x2="180" y2="65" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="185" y="70" font-size="14" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: AND requires ALL inputs to be 1. Check if all three inputs are 1.

questions.question: What is $1011_2 \times 11_2$ in binary?
questions.hint: Convert to decimal: $1011_2 = 11$, $11_2 = 3$. Multiply, then convert back to binary.

questions.question: Simplify: $A \lor (A \land B)$
questions.hint: Absorption law: if $A$ is true, the whole expression is true. If $A$ is false, $A \land B$ is also false.

questions.question: What is the range of signed 8-bit integers (two's complement)?
questions.hint: For $n$ bits: range is $-2^{n-1}$ to $2^{n-1}-1$. Calculate for $n=8$.

questions.question: What is the output of a 3-input OR gate with inputs $0, 0, 1$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Is there at least one $1$ among the inputs?

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{\overline{A}}$
questions.hint: Double negation: flipping something twice returns it to the original state.

questions.question: What is hexadecimal $\text{1F}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: Convert each hex digit: $1 = 0001$, $\text{F} = 1111$. Combine them in order.

questions.question: What is $100000_2 - 1$ in binary?
questions.hint: In binary, $100000_2$ is a power of $2$. Subtracting $1$ gives all $1$s in the positions below.

questions.question: Simplify: $A \oplus 0$
questions.hint: XOR with $0$: if $A=0$, result is $0$; if $A=1$, result is $1$. What's the pattern?

questions.question: Simplify: $A \oplus 1$
questions.hint: XOR with $1$: if $A=0$, result is $1$; if $A=1$, result is $0$. What operation is that?

questions.question: How many NAND gates are needed to make a NOT gate?
questions.hint: Connect both inputs of a NAND gate to the same signal. What does $A \barwedge A$ give?

questions.question: What is $-128$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: $-128$ is the most negative 8-bit value: just the sign bit set, all others zero.

questions.question: Simplify: $A \oplus A$
questions.hint: XOR gives $1$ when inputs differ. What happens when both inputs are the same?

questions.question: What is $(A \land B) \lor (A \land \overline{B})$ simplified?
questions.hint: Factor out the common term $A$. What remains in the parentheses always evaluates to true.

questions.question: Convert $-64$ to 8-bit two's complement.
questions.hint: Write $+64$ in binary, flip all bits, then add $1$. What pattern emerges?

questions.question: What is the output when $A=1$, $B=0$ through an XNOR gate?
questions.hint: XNOR outputs $1$ when inputs are the same, $0$ when different. Are $A$ and $B$ the same?

questions.question: What is $10101010_2$ in hexadecimal?
questions.hint: Split into nibbles: $1010$ and $1010$. Each $1010 = 10$ in decimal. What hex digit is $10$?

questions.question: Simplify: $(A \lor B) \land (A \lor \overline{B})$
questions.hint: Use the distributive property to factor out $A \lor$, then simplify what remains.

questions.question: What is the decimal value of 8-bit two's complement $10000001_2$?
questions.hint: MSB is $1$, so negative. Flip bits to get $01111110$, add $1$ to get $01111111$, then negate.

questions.question: How many NAND gates are needed to build an AND gate?
questions.hint: NAND followed by NOT gives AND. How many NANDs make a NOT?

questions.question: What is $11001100_2 \oplus 10101010_2$?
questions.hint: XOR each bit position: same bits give $0$, different bits give $1$.

questions.question: What is the output of a NOR gate when both inputs are $0$?
questions.hint: NOR is OR followed by NOT. First compute $0 \lor 0$, then invert the result.

questions.question: Convert hexadecimal $\text{7F}_{16}$ to decimal.
questions.hint: $\text{7F}_{16} = 7 \times 16 + 15$. Calculate the sum.

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{A \land B} \land \overline{A \land C}$
questions.hint: Apply De Morgan's law to each NAND term, then look for a common pattern.

questions.question: What is $-32$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: $+32 = 00100000_2$. Flip all bits, add $1$. What do you get?

questions.question: What is the output of $(A \oplus B) \oplus B$?
questions.hint: XOR is its own inverse. When you XOR something with $B$ twice, what happens to $B$?

questions.question: Convert $\text{D0}_{16}$ to binary.
questions.hint: $\text{D} = 1101$ and $0 = 0000$. Combine the nibbles.

questions.question: In a full adder, what are SUM and CARRY when $A=0$, $B=1$, $C_{in}=1$?
questions.hint: $0 + 1 + 1 = 2 = 10_2$. The rightmost bit is SUM, leftmost is CARRY.

questions.question: What Boolean function is implemented by the expression $\overline{\overline{A} \lor \overline{B}}$?
questions.hint: Apply De Morgan's law: NOT of an OR with inverted inputs becomes what?

questions.question: What is $10000000_2 + 10000000_2$ in 8-bit two's complement (with overflow)?
questions.hint: This is $-128 + (-128)$ in two's complement. The result overflows. What remains?

questions.question: What is the minimum number of 2-input NAND gates needed to build an OR gate?
questions.hint: OR can be built as: NOT each input, then NAND the results. How many NANDs total?

questions.question: Simplify: $A \land \overline{A}$
questions.hint: A variable ANDed with its complement: can both ever be true at the same time?

questions.question: What is the hexadecimal of decimal $128$?
questions.hint: $128 = 8 \times 16 + 0$. What are the two hex digits?

questions.question: What is $01111111_2 + 00000001_2$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: This is $127 + 1$. The result overflows from positive to negative. What bit pattern results?

questions.question: Simplify: $A \lor \overline{A}$
questions.hint: A variable ORed with its complement: is at least one of them always true?

questions.question: What is $\text{C3}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: $\text{C} = 1100$ and $3 = 0011$. Combine the nibbles in order.

questions.question: What is the output of an XOR gate when both inputs are $1$?
questions.hint: XOR outputs $1$ when inputs differ. What happens when both inputs are the same?

questions.question: Convert binary $01010101_2$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: Split into nibbles: $0101$ and $0101$. Each equals $5$ in decimal. What's the hex?

questions.question: What is the result of $1100_2 \land 1010_2$?
questions.hint: AND each bit position: both must be $1$ to get $1$ in the result.

questions.question: What is $-16$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: $+16 = 00010000_2$. Flip all bits to get $11101111_2$, then add $1$.

questions.question: Simplify: $(A \land B) \lor (\overline{A} \land B)$
questions.hint: Factor out the common term $B$. What remains in the parentheses?

questions.question: What is the result of $1100_2 \lor 1010_2$?
questions.hint: OR each bit position: if either bit is $1$, the result is $1$.

questions.question: How many bits are needed to represent decimal $1000$?
questions.hint: Find the smallest $n$ where $2^n > 1000$. Check powers of $2$ near $1000$.

questions.question: What is the output of a NAND gate when $A=0$, $B=1$?
questions.hint: NAND is AND followed by NOT. First compute $0 \land 1$, then invert.

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{A} \land (A \lor B)$
questions.hint: Distribute $\overline{A}$ over the OR. What happens to $\overline{A} \land A$?

questions.question: What is $\text{3C}_{16}$ in decimal?
questions.hint: $\text{3C}_{16} = 3 \times 16 + \text{C}$. Remember $\text{C} = 12$.

questions.question: What is the result of left-shifting $00001111_2$ by $2$ positions?
questions.hint: Left shift moves all bits left, filling with zeros on the right. What enters from the right?

questions.question: What is $-100$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: $+100 = 01100100_2$. Flip all bits, then add $1$.

questions.question: What gate is equivalent to $\overline{A \lor B}$?
questions.hint: NOR means NOT-OR. What does NOT of an OR operation give you?

questions.question: What is $11110000_2 \oplus 00001111_2$?
questions.hint: XOR each bit: these two patterns are complements of each other. What happens?

questions.question: In a 4-bit ripple carry adder, if $A=1111_2$, $B=0001_2$, what is the sum (ignoring overflow)?
questions.hint: $15 + 1 = 16$, but we only keep 4 bits. What remains after discarding the carry?

questions.question: Simplify: $A \land (\overline{A} \lor B)$
questions.hint: Distribute $A$ over the OR. What happens to $A \land \overline{A}$?

questions.question: What is the result of right-shifting $11110000_2$ by $3$ positions (logical shift)?
questions.hint: Logical right shift fills with zeros on the left. Move each bit $3$ positions right.

questions.question: What is the truth table output for $A \land B$ when $A=1$, $B=0$?
questions.hint: AND requires both inputs to be $1$. Is that the case here?

questions.question: Convert decimal $175$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: $175 \div 16 = 10$ remainder $15$. Convert both to hex digits.

questions.question: What is $(A \oplus B) \land (A \lor B)$ equivalent to?
questions.hint: The second term $(A \lor B)$ is always true when XOR is true. Does it change the result?

questions.question: What is the 8-bit two's complement of $-127$?
What is $\text{E7}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: $\text{E} = 1110$ and $7 = 0111$. Combine the nibbles.

questions.question: What is the output of the expression $\overline{A \oplus B}$?
questions.hint: NOT of XOR is called what? Think about when this outputs $1$ versus $0$.

questions.question: How many rows are in a truth table for a 4-input gate?
questions.hint: Each input can be $0$ or $1$. Total combinations = $2^n$ where $n$ is the number of inputs.

questions.question: What is $10110011_2$ AND $11001100_2$?
questions.hint: AND each bit position. Both must be $1$ to produce $1$.

questions.question: Simplify: $(\overline{A} \land B) \lor (A \land B)$
questions.hint: Factor out $B$: $B \land (\overline{A} \lor A)$. What does $\overline{A} \lor A$ equal?

questions.question: What is the result of a 4-input NAND gate with inputs $1,1,1,0$?
questions.hint: NAND is NOT-AND. First compute the 4-input AND, then invert.

questions.question: Convert $\text{9A}_{16}$ to decimal.
questions.hint: $\text{9A}_{16} = 9 \times 16 + \text{A}$. Remember $\text{A} = 10$.

questions.question: What is the carry output of a half adder when $A=0$, $B=1$?
questions.hint: CARRY $= A \land B$. What is $0 \land 1$?

questions.question: Simplify: $A \lor (\overline{A} \land B)$
questions.hint: Try both cases: when $A=1$ and when $A=0$. What expression covers both results?

questions.question: What is $11111111_2 \land 00001111_2$?
questions.hint: AND with all $1$s preserves the other operand. This is called masking.

questions.question: How many NOR gates are needed to make a NOT gate?
questions.hint: Connect both inputs of a NOR gate to the same signal. What does $(A \downarrow A)$ give?

questions.question: What is the decimal value of signed 8-bit binary $10101010_2$?
questions.hint: MSB is $1$, so negative. Flip bits, add $1$, then negate. $01010101 + 1 = 01010110 = 86$.

questions.question: What is the result of $1111_2 \oplus 1111_2$?
questions.hint: XOR of identical values: when both bits are the same, the result is always what?

questions.question: Convert binary $11100111_2$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: Split: $1110 = \text{E}$ and $0111 = 7$. Combine them.

questions.question: What is the output when $A=1$, $B=1$, $C=1$ through a 3-input NOR gate?
questions.hint: NOR: first OR all inputs, then NOT the result. What is $1 \lor 1 \lor 1$ inverted?

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{(A \land B) \lor (A \land C)}$
questions.hint: First factor out $A$, then apply De Morgan's law to the result.

questions.question: What is $1010_2 \times 101_2$ in binary?
questions.hint: Convert to decimal: $10 \times 5 = 50$. Convert $50$ back to binary.

questions.question: What is the range of unsigned 16-bit integers?
questions.hint: Unsigned: all bits represent magnitude. Maximum is $2^{16} - 1$.

questions.question: What gate is equivalent to $(A \land B) \lor (\overline{A} \land \overline{B})$?
questions.hint: This expression is true when both inputs are the same. What gate behaves that way?

questions.question: What is $\text{4B}_{16}$ in decimal?
questions.hint: $\text{4B}_{16} = 4 \times 16 + \text{B}$. Remember $\text{B} = 11$.

questions.question: What is the result of arithmetic right-shifting $10000100_2$ by $2$ positions?
questions.hint: Arithmetic right shift preserves the sign bit. What fills in from the left?

questions.question: Simplify: $(A \lor B) \land (\overline{A} \lor B)$
questions.hint: Factor using the consensus theorem, or try both cases: $B=0$ and $B=1$.

questions.question: What is $11111111_2 \lor 00000000_2$?
questions.hint: OR with all zeros leaves the other operand unchanged.

questions.question: Convert decimal $239$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: $239 \div 16 = 14$ remainder $15$. Convert both to hex digits.

questions.question: What is $-1 + (-1)$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: $-1 = 11111111_2$. Add two of these together. What's $-2$ in two's complement?

questions.question: What Boolean expression represents a 2-input NAND gate?
questions.hint: NAND is NOT-AND. What's the expression for negating an AND operation?

questions.question: What is the output of XOR when $A=0$, $B=0$?
questions.hint: XOR outputs $1$ only when inputs differ. What happens when they're the same?

questions.question: What is $\text{BD}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: $\text{B} = 1011$ and $\text{D} = 1101$. Combine the nibbles.

questions.question: How many 2-input NOR gates are needed to build an AND gate?
questions.hint: AND using NOR: NOT each input with NOR, then NOR the results. Count the gates.

questions.question: Simplify: $(A \land B) \lor A$
questions.hint: Absorption law in reverse: if $A$ is true, the whole expression is true.

questions.question: What is the decimal value of signed 8-bit $01111111_2$?
questions.hint: MSB is $0$, so positive. Just convert the remaining bits as usual.

questions.question: What is $10000000_2 - 00000001_2$ in 8-bit two's complement?
questions.hint: This is $-128 - 1$. The result overflows to the largest positive value.

questions.question: What is the output of a multiplexer with $S=0$, $I_0=1$, $I_1=0$?
questions.hint: When select $S=0$, the multiplexer outputs $I_0$. What is $I_0$?

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{A} \lor (A \land B)$
questions.hint: Try cases: when $A=0$ and when $A=1$. What expression matches both results?

questions.question: What is $\text{F0}_{16}$ XOR $\text{0F}_{16}$ in hexadecimal?
questions.hint: Convert to binary: $11110000 \oplus 00001111$. XOR bit by bit.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the carry-in bit in a full adder?
questions.hint: In multi-bit addition, each stage needs to know if the previous stage produced a carry.

questions.question: Convert $-10$ to 8-bit two's complement.
questions.hint: $+10 = 00001010_2$. Flip all bits, then add $1$.

questions.question: What is the output of $(A \barwedge B) \barwedge (A \barwedge B)$?
questions.hint: NAND of something with itself is NOT of that thing. What is NOT of NAND?

questions.question: What is $11001010_2$ in decimal (unsigned)?
questions.hint: Add the powers of $2$: $128 + 64 + 8 + 2$.

questions.question: Simplify: $A \land (B \lor \overline{A})$
questions.hint: Distribute $A$ over the OR. What happens to $A \land \overline{A}$?

questions.question: What is the hexadecimal of decimal $192$?
questions.hint: $192 = 12 \times 16 + 0$. What's $12$ in hex?

questions.question: What is the result of a 4-input XOR with inputs $1,1,1,1$?
questions.hint: Multi-input XOR counts the number of $1$s. If even, output is $0$; if odd, output is $1$.

questions.question: What is $\text{5F}_{16}$ in decimal?
questions.hint: $\text{5F}_{16} = 5 \times 16 + \text{F}$. Remember $\text{F} = 15$.

questions.question: What is the output of a half adder SUM when $A=0$, $B=0$?
questions.hint: SUM $= A \oplus B$. What is $0 \oplus 0$?

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{A \land (B \lor C)}$
questions.hint: Apply De Morgan's law, then apply it again to the second term.

questions.question: What is the result of $1010_2$ NOR $0101_2$?
questions.hint: First OR: $1111_2$. Then NOT the result.

questions.question: Convert binary $10011001_2$ to hexadecimal.
questions.hint: Split: $1001 = 9$ and $1001 = 9$. Combine them.

questions.question: What does a decoder with 3 inputs have for outputs?
questions.hint: A decoder with $n$ inputs has $2^n$ outputs. Calculate for $n=3$.

questions.question: Simplify: $(A \lor B) \land (A \lor C) \land (B \lor C)$
questions.hint: This is the dual of the median function. Think about when at least two variables are true.

questions.question: What is $\text{6E}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: $6 = 0110$ and $\text{E} = 1110$. Combine the nibbles.

questions.question: What is the output of a 2-to-4 decoder when input is $10_2$?
questions.hint: The input value determines which output is active. $10_2 = 2$ in decimal.

questions.question: What is $127 + 1$ in 8-bit signed two's complement?
questions.hint: $127 = 01111111_2$, adding $1$ gives $10000000_2$. What's that in signed representation?

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{(\overline{A} \lor B) \land (A \lor \overline{B})}$
questions.hint: The inner expression is XNOR. What is NOT of XNOR?

questions.question: What is decimal $225$ in hexadecimal?
questions.hint: $225 \div 16 = 14$ remainder $1$. What's $14$ in hex?

questions.question: What is the result of a 4-input AND with inputs $1,1,1,1$?
questions.hint: AND requires all inputs to be $1$. Are all four inputs $1$?

questions.question: What is $11110000_2$ NAND $11110000_2$?
questions.hint: NAND of identical values: first AND them (same result), then NOT.

questions.question: Convert $\text{A5}_{16}$ to decimal.
questions.hint: $\text{A5}_{16} = \text{A} \times 16 + 5 = 10 \times 16 + 5$.

questions.question: What is the SUM output of a full adder when $A=0$, $B=0$, $C_{in}=1$?
questions.hint: $0 + 0 + 1 = 1$. The SUM is the rightmost bit of the result.

questions.question: Simplify: $(A \land B) \lor (A \land \overline{B}) \lor (\overline{A} \land B)$
questions.hint: Group the first two terms: $A \land (B \lor \overline{B}) = A$. Now OR with the third term.

questions.question: What is the output of an SR latch when $S=1$, $R=0$?
questions.hint: $S=1$ means Set. What state does the latch go to when Set is active?

questions.question: What is $\text{77}_{16}$ in binary?
questions.hint: $7 = 0111$ and $7 = 0111$. Combine the nibbles.

questions.question: What is the maximum positive value in 16-bit signed two's complement?
questions.hint: For $n$ bits signed, max positive is $2^{n-1} - 1$. Calculate for $n=16$.

questions.question: Simplify: $\overline{(A \lor B) \land (C \lor D)}$
questions.hint: Apply De Morgan's law: NOT of AND becomes OR, then apply De Morgan again to each term.
